results.title: Sam Smith: Genuine England
results.creator_credit: Shaw Ashton, Andrew Lee and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: An insight into the life and work of Sam Smith, doll-maker extraordinaire. He relates snippets from his life as he discusses the making of his unusual dolls.

results.title: New settlers of the inland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
This program looks at the people who are forming alternative settlements in the Rainbow Region of Ne South Wales. Examines their motivation for leaving the city and shows the lifestyle they are now pursuing.

results.title: The People v the 'roo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
The kangaroo is observed in its own environment, and the people who are most likely to affect its future are interviewed: the grazier, the wildlife officer, the shooter and the pet food supplier.

results.title: Dingo country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A fence almost 6,000 miles long stretches from South Australia to Queensland and attempts to separate the dingo from the sheep. The dingoes are vigorously hunted and killed, but the film presents the view that man must learn to acept the dingo.

results.title: Robert Richard Torrens
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the origin and history of the Torrens Title System. Shows Torrens’ work as Registrar-General and Member of Parliament, in the securing of land tenure in South Australia. Insecurity had plagued early settlers in South Australia, until Torrens’ land title reform bill was passed in 1857. Unsatisfactory registered transactions were replaced by a single certificate, one copy being held by the Registrar-General and the other by the owner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
